description:
RESAMPLE A METRIC FILE TO A DIFFERENT MESH.

Resamples a metric file, given two spherical surfaces that are in register.  If ADAP_BARY_AREA is used, exactly one of -area-surfs or -area-metrics must be specified.

The ADAP_BARY_AREA method is recommended for ordinary metric data, because it should use all data while downsampling, unlike BARYCENTRIC.  The recommended areas option for most data is individual midthicknesses for individual data, and averaged vertex area metrics from individual midthicknesses for group average data.

The -current-roi option only masks the input, the output may be slightly dilated in comparison, consider using -metric-mask on the output when using -current-roi.

The -largest option results in nearest vertex behavior when used with BARYCENTRIC.  When resampling a binary metric, consider thresholding at 0.5 after resampling rather than using -largest.

The <method> argument must be one of the following:

ADAP_BARY_AREA
BARYCENTRIC

current-area.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <current-sphere> mesh

new-area.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <new-sphere> mesh

anyOf.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

area-surfs.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

current-area.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <current-sphere> mesh

new-area.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <new-sphere> mesh

anyOf.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

area-metrics.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

roi-metric.description:
use an input roi on the current mesh to exclude non-data vertices

the roi, as a metric file

roi-out.description:
output the ROI of vertices that got data from valid source vertices

the output roi as a metric

largest.description: use only the value of the vertex with the largest weight

bypass-sphere-check.description: ADVANCED: allow the current and new 'spheres' to have arbitrary shape as long as they follow the same contour

current-sphere.description: a sphere surface with the mesh that the metric is currently on

new-sphere.description: a sphere surface that is in register with <current-sphere> and has the desired output mesh
